Class Admin

java.lang.Object
com.mycompany.payrollsystem.system.user.Admin
public class Admin extends Object
Admin class represents an admin user in the payroll system Provides functionality to manage staff such as adding staff members, viewing staff details, and saving staff information to a CSV file

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Admin()
     

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    addStaff()
    Adds a new staff member to the payroll system Prompts the admin to enter staff type, name, ID, title, scale point, and password, and then adds the staff member to the system Has some error checking, will not allow a scalePoint higher than the highest scalePoint associated with The employees current title to be input, and if it is it will tell the user the highest scalePoint available
    int
    readInt(String message)
    Reads an integer input from the user
    void
    viewStaff()
    Displays all staff details and saves them to the CSV file If there are no staff members, displays a message indicating so

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      public int readInt(String message)
      Reads an integer input from the user
      Parameters:
      message - message to display when prompting for input
      Returns:
      integer input from the user

    • addStaff

      public void addStaff()
      Adds a new staff member to the payroll system Prompts the admin to enter staff type, name, ID, title, scale point, and password, and then adds the staff member to the system Has some error checking, will not allow a scalePoint higher than the highest scalePoint associated with The employees current title to be input, and if it is it will tell the user the highest scalePoint available

    • viewStaff

      public void viewStaff()
      Displays all staff details and saves them to the CSV file If there are no staff members, displays a message indicating so
